------------------------------------------------------------------------
This file, cl.xml, is the OpenCL API Registry spec file. At present it only contains OpenCL enumerant reservations and definitions, and extension number reservations. It is (probably) not syntactically valid XML at this time, and has no formal schema defined.

enums.comment: Error codes start at 0 and decrease
Extension error codes start at -1000 and decrease
Allocated for cl_ext_device_fission and by email request from Ian Ollman 2010/07/08
RESERVED FOR FUTURE ALLOCATIONS BY KHRONOS
Tokens whose numeric value is intrinsically meaningful
Property names for CL_DEVICE_PARTITION_BY_AFFINITY_DOMAIN_EXT. This is not a bitfield.

registry.enums: <enum value="(1 << 0)" name="CL_DEVICE_TYPE_DEFAULT"/> <enum value="(1 << 1)" name="CL_DEVICE_TYPE_CPU"/> <enum value="(1 << 2)" name="CL_DEVICE_TYPE_GPU"/> <enum value="(1 << 3)" name="CL_DEVICE_TYPE_ACCELERATOR"/> <enum value="(1 << 4)" name="CL_DEVICE_TYPE_CUSTOM"/> <unused start="1<<5" end="1<<31"/>

<enum value="(1<<0)" name="CL_QUEUE_PRIORITY_HIGH_KHR"/> <enum value="(1<<1)" name="CL_QUEUE_PRIORITY_MED_KHR"/> <enum value="(1<<2)" name="CL_QUEUE_PRIORITY_LOW_KHR"/> <unused start="1<<3" end="1="<<31"/>

enums.comment: Reserved for interop with other APIs
Per Bug 6261 (IBM), then Bug 13603 giving control to AMD

enum.name: CL_COMMAND_MIGRATE_MEM_OBJECT_EXT
enum.comment: From cl_ext_migrate_memobject. Benign collision with the following enum.

enums.comment: Reserved for vendor extensions. Allocate in groups of 16.
Experimental range for internal development only. Do not allocate.
Legacy assignment before current enum allocation policy
